result.execSummary:
The defendant Robin W. Longley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Pay costs of the action. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.
Obtain AODA assessment and comply with treatment recommendations.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Robin W. Longley in court with attorney Brett E Reetz. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State/Defense make statements regarding sentencing. Defendant makes statement. Court reviews max. penalties, imposes sentence. Bond no longer in effect.

Defendant Robin W. Longley in court with attorney Brett E Reetz. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest plea. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds plea made freely and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds Defendant guilty. Court questions Defendant, who agrees with repeater status. State/Defense make sentencing recommendations (not joint). Defense advises that Defendant rejects probation. Defendant makes statement. Court reschedules sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 18, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol. To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving Justice Center.

Defendant Robin W. Longley in court. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court. Court reviews charge, max. penalties, right to counsel. Defendant wants to try to resolve matter with DA, waives right to Counsel. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver. Defendant to make appointment with DA. Bond set.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 13, 2016 at 10:45 am.
